Guide.title: Grid Records
Guide.html: Matching ##GridEntityPlural## are shown in the grid. Use the Open button to drill down into the ##GridEntitySingular## record.

Guide.title: Grid Column Sort
Guide.html: You can sort each column by clicking on the column name to toggle between ascending/descending, or click on the down arrow to the right of the column caption to open a drop down menu which can be used to sort, filter and choose columns to be displayed.

Guide.title: Grid Column Filters
Guide.html: You can filter each column by typing into the column filter text box, or by using the column caption down arrow drop down menu.

Guide.title: Grid Column Filter Pattern
Guide.html: You can changes the text filter pattern by clicking on the funnel button to drop down a menu of search patterns.

Guide.title: Grid Column Move
Guide.html: You can move grid columns into different positions, by holding down the mouse and dragging the column to a new position.

Guide.title: Grid Column Selection
Guide.html: You can add additional columns to the grid, or remove existing columns from the grid by clicking the down arrow in the column caption and choosing the Columns drop down menu.

Guide.title: Grid Paging
Guide.html: A page of data is displayed in the grid. You can move to the next or previous page by clicking on these grid footer buttons.

Guide.title: Grid Row Selection
Guide.html: You can select one or more grid rows by clicking the check box to the left of the grid. This is useful if you wish to run actions against one or more records.

Guide.title: File Menu Button
Guide.html: The file button drops down a menu of all functions relating to ##GridEntityPlural## displayed in this grid. You can create new records, open selected records or delete records.

Guide.title: Grid Menu Button
Guide.html: The grid button drops down a menu allowing you to select all visible ##GridEntityPlural##, or de-select all records. You can also refresh the grid data.

Guide.title: Actions Menu Button
Guide.html: The actions button drops down a menu allowing you to run an action against the selected ##GridEntityPlural## in the grid.

Guide.title: CV Auto-Recognition Form
Guide.html: This form allows you to import CV's/Resumes into the database to create candidate contact records.

Guide.title: Incoming CV's Tab
Guide.html: Pressing this button displays all of the CV's which are ready for processing. You can drag files from your computer into this grid to add them to this list.

Guide.title: Incoming CV's Grid
Guide.html: Pressing this button displays all of the CV's which are ready for processing.

Guide.title: Import Tab
Guide.html: This tab will be highlighted when a CV is being processed.

Guide.title: Duplicate Tab
Guide.html: Pressing this tab will show a list of potential duplicate candidates.

Guide.title: Add Button
Guide.html:
Pressing this button will popup an 'Upload CV Document' window:

You can drag files from your computer into the dotted rectangle, or click the dotted rectangle to choose a local file, or click the cloud to choose a file from social media.

Guide.title: Import Button
Guide.html: Pressing this button will commence the import of the selected document.

Guide.title: Delete Button
Guide.html: Pressing this button will remove the selected document from the grid.

Guide.title: Contact Form
Guide.html: This form is where you can view and edit both client and candidate contact details, as well as carry out a range of sophisticated business operations using actions.

Guide.title: Contact Master Record
Guide.html: These are the key fields which identify this contact such as the forename(s)/first name + middle names, surname/last name, type (client, candidate or user), job title, title, marital status, gender, status, comments and photo.

Guide.title: Contact Tabs
Guide.html: These tabs/buttons are used to show additional information such as personal details, employment, attributes/skills, social networks, requirements, placements, documents, notes/history and scheduled tasks.

Guide.title: Save Button
Guide.html: Pressing this button will save all changes to the current record to the database, and update the form caption with the full contact name and optionally the ID.

Guide.title: File Menu
Guide.html:
This menu has the following options:
New - clear the current fields ready for a new record to be entered
Open - popup a find dialogue to lookup a contact record and open it
Save - save all changes to the current record to the database
Delete - delete the current record from the database
Close - close this form and do not save changes

Guide.title: Actions Menu
Guide.html:
This menu has the following options:
Add to Shortlist - choose one or more requirements and add this contact to their shortlists
Call - make a telephone call and record the outcome
E-Mail - send an ad-hoc e-mail and record it
Mail Merge - send a template driven e-mail with notes and follow-ups
Meeting - schedule a meeting with confirmation e-mail
Note - record a note
Send SMS Text - send a text message
ToDo - schedule a task linked to this contact
